title: 111_hr1908
content: The Act is titled the "Water Accountability Tax Efficiency Reinvestment Act of 2009" or the "WATER Act of 2009." It includes a credit for Watersense program property in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The "Water Accountability Tax Efficiency Reinvestment Act of 2009" allows a 30% tax credit for certified WaterSense program property expenses, with a lifetime limit of $1,500 per taxpayer. Certified property must meet EPA WaterSense program requirements and be newly used by the taxpayer. The tax credit allowed under the "Water Accountability Tax Efficiency Reinvestment Act of 2009" is applicable to property subject to depreciation and is treated as a general business credit. Additionally, the credit is limited based on the amount of tax owed by the taxpayer. The tax credit allowed under the "Water Accountability Tax Efficiency Reinvestment Act of 2009" is limited based on the taxpayer's tax liability for the year, with specific rules for aggregation of employers. The tax credit under the "Water Accountability Tax Efficiency Reinvestment Act of 2009" limits the credit based on the taxpayer's tax liability, with rules for aggregation of employers. The basis of property for which a credit is allowed is reduced by the amount of the credit, and no double benefit is allowed for deductions or credits. No credit is allowed for property used outside the United States. No credit shall be allowable under subsection (a) with respect to any property referred to in section 50(b)(1). This section shall not apply to any property placed in service after December 31, 2010. Various sections of the Code are amended to include references to new provisions such as 30E. Section 1400C(d)(2) of the Code is amended to include reference to section 30E. Additionally, section 1016(a) is amended to include a new paragraph related to section 30E(e)(2). The table of sections for subpart B of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1 is also amended to include a new item related to section 30E. The amendments made by section 30E apply to property placed in service after the enactment of this Act.
